sub_title: Freelance Senior Copywriter, Content Strategist and Concept Developer with international, multi-industry experience
summary:
Over 25 years’ experience in (native English) copywriting, communication and marketing across a broad diversity of industries and countries. Currently dividing my time between the UK and the Netherlands, and available to clients anywhere.

My breadth of experience means I'm not a specialist in any specific industry, but a chameleon who brings valuable outside perspective. A quality which can break the stalemate of internal focus suffered by many companies. This comes with an inherent desire to make the entire jigsaw fit. I never look at words without interrogating the actions and processes they're designed to trigger. Contributing analytical, solution-focussed thinking to everything from backroom brainstorming to front-line promotion. Always conscious of audience and stakeholder needs and expectations.

Being both creative and logical, I particularly relish the challenge of transforming complex back-stories into tangible, audience-friendly propositions and narratives. An enthusiasm that extends into packaging up any subject matter into appealing reads and clear directives. 

I'm particularly useful to companies and organisations who need to reach international audiences, having gained experience with clients based in the UK, USA, Netherlands, Belgium, France, Germany, Spain, Japan and Israel.

“Meedenker”
My Dutch clients often describe me as a “meedenker” (pronounced "may-denker"). It’s one of those words for which there’s no direct equivalent in English, although your translation tool-of-choice will certainly give it a go! It literally means “a person who thinks along with”. Essentially someone who proactively works with others, contributing to their creative and problem-solving efforts. 

It’s a label I’m proud to have. As it nicely sums up my passion for helping others succeed by complementing their expertise and thought-processes with my own. 


For more about my experience, skills and current activities, see MiriamYoung.com.

projects.title: Staples Back to School campaign 2015
projects.description: Devised the 'Release the Talent' concept which won the internal agency competition to be used for Staples' pan-European 2015 Back to School campaign.

contributors.headline: Freelance Senior Copywriter, Content Strategist and Concept Developer with international, multi-industry experience

projects.title: ACT Commodities website
projects.description:
ACT Commodities is a trading house focused on environmental commodities such as renewable energy, carbon emissions, energy efficiency and biofuels. They trade a broad range of certifications and physical energy products which industry uses for both environmental compliance and voluntary carbon footprint reduction purposes. In addition to these, ACT also trades mineral fuels and various products within the biofuel production chain. This adds up to a complex mix of commodities and related support services.

ACT Commodities wanted to create a completely new website which would reflect the company’s collaborative trading ethos and high level of customer service, while outlining its product portfolio in a logically structured way. Its aims were to reassure existing contacts, attract new clients and appeal to prospective new employees.

Because the content to be communicated had not previously been curated, the exact structure of the website could not be pre-determined. We therefore had to take an agile approach to developing the website. I worked closely with the project manager Floortje Geuze to achieve this. The two of us embedded ourselves in the company – working on-site 2 days a week – so we could get a feel of the culture while acquiring all the necessary input. During my 10-week involvement, I interviewed many of the company’s employees to obtain the relevant facts and piece together the marketing story. I then translated their input into client-focused copy, which I structured to fit the website design layout, navigation flow and SEO requirements.  You can see the result at ACTcommodities.com.

projects.title: Philips intranet transition
projects.description:
To replace an outdated intranet consisting of 123,000 pages across numerous dissipated sites, Royal Philips embarked on a massive project to distil and transition the content into a consistent, searchable SharePoint intranet, which received an international 2016 Intranet & Digital Workplace Award. 

Together with other content editors and publishers, I worked on a team comprising of content architects and IT professionals via Scrum to deliver ongoing targeted progress in a project with frequently-adjusting circumstances. Tasks included liaising with stakeholders throughout the global Philips organisation, contextualising and editing content within Philips guidelines and entering correct tagging and presentation in the SharePoint CMS.

Going beyond the brief I was originally brought in to fulfil, I proposed and created an extensive online training resource which will be used by those editing content in the future. Achieving this involved simplifying and arranging a complex set of guidelines into digestible, easily searchable sections, which acted as live demonstrations of the way Philips' new intranet is intended to be used.

contributors.headline: Freelance Senior Copywriter, Content Strategist and Concept Developer with international, multi-industry experience

profile_positions.description:
Planting Stories is my own business through which I perform copywriting, content strategy, concept development and flow-related thinking for every kind of B2B and B2C purpose and channel.

Deliverables include marketing materials, sales brochures, advertising, press releases, editorial articles, voice-over scripts, presentations, websites, business proposals, white papers, blog posts, internal & external communications, promotional events planning and whatever else my clients need. 

Ook Nederlands naar Engels vertaling en transcreation. (Native English copywriter for Dutch to English translation.)

I’ve worked with every type of entity, from big brands, industry heavyweights and government agencies to niche players, specialist experts and enthusiastic start-ups. Both directly and via globally renowned and specialist creative agencies. Having served clients from many different countries, and worked within multi-nationality teams, I am at home in an international environment. 

I’m a critical analyst and never shy to challenge a brief that doesn’t seem watertight. Or, indeed, develop the brief together with you.

Having worked with so many different clients and industries, I'm very used to stepping into new situations, assessing them at face value, and applying the benefits of other experiences without the baggage of over-familiarity.
profile_positions.title: Senior Copywriter, Content Strategist, Concept Developer and Dutch to English Transcreator

profile_positions.description:
Reporting directly to the company owners with full responsibility for initiating, planning, managing, producing and executing all PR and marketing activities to the UK, USA, Canada and various European countries, among both B2B and B2C audiences. 

Combining acquired horticulture industry knowledge with previous media industry experience, I raised the bar in international horticulture communications. My work transformed perception of Darwin Plants from a little-considered company to one of the leading players in the field, who became one of the first ports of call for many garden writers, lecturers and TV researchers when looking for products to feature.

Copywriting: press releases, magazine articles, website content, sales catalogue, promotional brochures, point-of-sale materials, sales presentations. 
Communications: building, developing and utilising relationships with journalists, customers, suppliers, plant breeders, garden designers, retailers, horticultural colleges and others. Distributing press-releases, attending industry events, giving presentations, planning exhibits. Negotiation/purchase of advertising space.
Notable achievements: 
Development of the Darwin PlantSpotters consumer brand.
Writing PlantSpotters.com, which was nominated for the UK Garden Writers Guild Website of the Year in 2004. My articles inspired Canadian TV series Recreating Eden to visit the Netherlands in 2006 to film an episode.
Constructing and arranging a schedule of visits that formed a part of the 2006 European tour by the Garden Writers Association of America. 
Management of project to raise charitable donations from plant sales for The British Red Cross, which was given a high profile media launch at the 2005 Chelsea Flower Show with follow-up at Gardeners’ World Live. 
Invited to speak at The Des Moines Botanical Center (USA) and the CanWest horticulture trade show (Canada).
As a sales representative, developed the previously neglected UK market into a key territory.
